init

public void init(java.lang.String aName,
                 UnaryPredicate aPredicate,
                 long deletionDelay,
                 int priority)
Initialize this policy.

Parameters:
aName - a name for this policy used in printouts and for debugging
aPredicate - A predicate for selecting Tasks for which this policy applies
deletionDelay - The age the tasks must reach before being deleted
priority - When multiple policies apply to a task, the highest priority policy wins and the rest are ignored.

Add

public void Add(RuleParameter param)
Description copied from class: Policy
Adds a new RuleParameter to the set stored in the Policy. This should be the sole means for putting parameters into the policy and can be overridden if desired to take special action such as caching certain parameters for quicker access.

Overrides:
Add in class Policy
Parameters:
param - the new param to be added to the Policy

clearCache

public void clearCache()

getPredicate

public UnaryPredicate getPredicate()
Description copied from interface: DeletionPolicy
Get the predicate for this policy. The predicate should return true when applied to objects to which this policy applies.

Specified by:
getPredicate in interface DeletionPolicy
Returns:
the predicate selecting objects for which this policy applies.

setDeletionDelay

public void setDeletionDelay(long deletionDelay)

getDeletionDelay

public long getDeletionDelay()
Description copied from interface: DeletionPolicy
Get the additional delay (in scenario time) that should be inserted before a blackboard object is deleted.

Specified by:
getDeletionDelay in interface DeletionPolicy
Returns:
the number of milliseconds of delay before deletion.

getPriority

public int getPriority()
Description copied from interface: DeletionPolicy
Get the priority of this policy over other deletion policies. When multiple policies match an object the highest priority policy is used.

Specified by:
getPriority in interface DeletionPolicy
Returns:
the priority of this policy.
